sentences.en: A lot of these children have been deprived of a normal home life.
sentences.cn: 这些孩子中有许多被剥夺了正常的家庭生活。

sentences.en: Capital punishment is executed to deprive a person of his life.
sentences.cn: 死刑(deathpenalty,capitalpunishment),以剥夺人的生命为执行内容.

sentences.en: Circumstances undoubtedly deprive many potential managers of opportunity; few may succeed to top position.
sentences.cn: 无疑,许多有潜在能力的管理者受环境影响,而失去良机, 只有少数人能得到高位.

sentences.en: Dr Proudie would consent to deprive the church of all collective authority and rule.
sentences.cn: 普劳迪博士会同意夺走教会的全部集体权力与统治.

sentences.en: He had sought to deprive us of dime.
sentences.cn: 他企图剥夺我们一角钱.

sentences.en: I pray you let me not deprive you of your servant.
sentences.cn: 请不要让我占用您的仆人.

sentences.en: I would rather die than have anyone deprive me of this boast.
sentences.cn: 因为我宁可死,也不叫人使我所夸的落了空.

sentences.en: I would suggest you save your own life before you try to deprive me of mine.
sentences.cn: 我建议取我命之前,先保护你自己.

sentences.en: If found, we will deprive of rights of HL membership.
sentences.cn: 若被发现, 我们将取消其HL会籍.

sentences.en: Shall we deprive them of the right to vote?
sentences.cn: 是不是剥夺他们的选举权?

sentences.en: Such contracts deprive insurers of the opportunity to recalibrate risks.
sentences.cn: 这种合同使得保险公司失去机会重新评估风险的大小.

sentences.en: The trees outside the windows deprive the house of light.
sentences.cn: 窗外的树木把房子遮挡得暗然无光.

sentences.en: There are some trees that deprive the house of light.
sentences.cn: 有一些遮住房中光线的树木.

sentences.en: These verbs mean to deprive of self - esteem or self - worth .
sentences.cn: 这些动词都表示剥夺 自尊 的意思.

sentences.en: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
sentences.cn: 他们无法得到住房取暖必需的燃料。

sentences.en: Too many trees round a house deprive it of light and air.
sentences.cn: 房屋四周树木太多会使室内光线和空气都感不足.

sentences.en: You even want to deprive us of the freedom of our hearts.
sentences.cn: 我们心里的自由你都要剥夺了.

trans.tran_cn: 剥夺，使丧失，使不能享有
trans.tran_en: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it
If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it
